channel.title: Last Day - NEW & UPDATE
channel.description: All NEW and UPDATE articles from the last day with enhanced metadata

item.title: NEW: URGENT: CISA Mandates Patch for Actively Exploited WSUS RCE Flaw
item.description:
Headline: URGENT: CISA Mandates Patch for Actively Exploited WSUS RCE Flaw

Summary:
Microsoft has released an emergency out-of-band patch for a critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability, CVE-2025-59287, in Windows Server Update Service (WSUS). The flaw, which allows unauthenticated attackers to gain SYSTEM privileges, is being actively exploited in the wild. The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added the vulnerability to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, issuing an emergency directive for federal agencies to apply the patch immediately. With a public proof-of-concept exploit available and an estimated 2,500 servers still exposed, organizations are urged to patch or apply mitigations without delay.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: Microsoft releases an emergency out-of-band patch for a critical, actively exploited RCE vulnerability (CVE-2025-59287) in Windows Server Update Service (WSUS). CISA adds it to KEV, mandating immediate action.

Article Slug: critical-microsoft-wsus-flaw-cve-2025-59287-actively-exploited

Published Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Microsoft's Massive October Patch Tuesday Tackles 193 Flaws, 6 Zero-Days
item.description:
Headline: Microsoft's Massive October Patch Tuesday Tackles 193 Flaws, 6 Zero-Days

Summary:
Microsoft's October 2025 Patch Tuesday security update is one of the largest of the year, addressing 193 vulnerabilities across its product ecosystem. The update includes patches for nine critical flaws and, most notably, six zero-day vulnerabilities, four of which were actively exploited in the wild. Key products affected include Windows, Office, and various server components. This release also marks the final security update for Windows 10, ending its support lifecycle. Concurrently, Adobe released patches for 36 vulnerabilities in its software, urging users to update their systems promptly to mitigate significant security risks.

Severity: High

Categories: Patch Management, Vulnerability

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Microsoft's October 2025 Patch Tuesday addresses 193 vulnerabilities, including 9 critical flaws and 6 zero-days. This marks the final security update for Windows 10.

Article Slug: microsoft-october-2025-patch-tuesday-fixes-193-flaws-6-zero-days

Published Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: UK and Singapore Launch Global Guidance to Defend Supply Chains from Ransomware
item.description:
Headline: UK and Singapore Launch Global Guidance to Defend Supply Chains from Ransomware

Summary:
The United Kingdom and Singapore have launched new international guidance aimed at helping organizations defend against the escalating threat of supply chain ransomware attacks. Unveiled at a summit for the Counter Ransomware Initiative (CRI), the framework has been endorsed by all 67 member nations. It provides businesses with practical steps to assess the security posture of their suppliers and mitigate vulnerabilities. The initiative comes in response to recent high-profile attacks, such as the one on NHS supplier Synnovis, which demonstrated the cascading and disruptive impact of targeting a single entity within a complex supply chain.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Supply Chain Attack, Ransomware

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: The UK and Singapore have launched new international guidance, endorsed by 67 nations, to help organizations defend against supply chain ransomware attacks by improving supplier security.

Article Slug: uk-singapore-lead-global-initiative-to-secure-supply-chains-from-ransomware

Published Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Ransomware Attacks Surge 50% in 2025; Qilin Group Takes the Lead
item.description:
Headline: Ransomware Attacks Surge 50% in 2025; Qilin Group Takes the Lead

Summary:
Cybersecurity researchers report a staggering 50% increase in ransomware attacks in 2025, with over 5,000 incidents claimed on dark web leak sites by late October. This surge occurs amidst a significant realignment in the ransomware ecosystem, with formerly dominant groups fading while new and resurgent actors like Qilin take their place. The Qilin group has been particularly prolific, leading in victim counts for most of the past six months. The United States remains the most targeted nation, and the industrial sector is the most heavily impacted industry. PowerShell has become the primary tool for attackers, used in nearly 78% of observed campaigns.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A 50% surge in ransomware attacks is reported for 2025, with the Qilin group emerging as a dominant threat actor. The industrial sector is the most targeted, and PowerShell is the primary attack vector.

Article Slug: ransomware-attacks-skyrocket-50-percent-in-2025-qilin-emerges-as-leader

Published Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Massive 'Smishing Triad' Campaign Uses 194,000+ Domains for Global Data Theft
item.description:
Headline: Massive 'Smishing Triad' Campaign Uses 194,000+ Domains for Global Data Theft

Summary:
A highly sophisticated and widespread smishing (SMS phishing) campaign, attributed to a China-linked group dubbed the 'Smishing Triad,' has utilized over 194,000 malicious domains since early 2024. Researchers at Palo Alto Networks' Unit 42 exposed the campaign's massive scale, revealing a decentralized ecosystem of threat actors using fraudulent text messages about unpaid tolls and package deliveries. The primary goal is harvesting a wide range of personal and financial data from victims globally, with a significant focus on the United States. The operation uses rapid domain turnover and a mix of Chinese and U.S. infrastructure to evade detection.

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Threat Actor, Mobile Security

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Researchers uncover a massive smishing campaign by the 'Smishing Triad' group, using over 194,000 malicious domains to send fake toll and package delivery alerts to steal personal and financial data.

Article Slug: smishing-triad-campaign-linked-to-194000-malicious-domains

Published Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: LockBit Is Back: Notorious Ransomware Group Returns with Upgraded 'LockBit 5.0'
item.description:
Headline: LockBit Is Back: Notorious Ransomware Group Returns with Upgraded 'LockBit 5.0'

Summary:
The notorious LockBit ransomware group has made a definitive comeback following a major law enforcement disruption earlier in the year. Security researchers at Check Point have identified a new wave of attacks utilizing a significantly upgraded encryptor, dubbed 'LockBit 5.0'. This new variant boasts multi-platform support for Windows, Linux, and ESXi, along with enhanced anti-detection features. The group has actively recruited new affiliates on underground forums and has already targeted at least a dozen organizations across Europe, the Americas, and Asia, signaling the return of one of the world's most prolific ransomware threats.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Malware

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The LockBit ransomware group has resurfaced with a new, more powerful 'LockBit 5.0' variant after a law enforcement takedown, targeting organizations globally across Windows, Linux, and ESXi platforms.

Article Slug: lockbit-ransomware-resurfaces-with-new-lockbit-5-0-variant

Published Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Google Issues Emergency Patch for Critical Chrome RCE Flaw Found by AI
item.description:
Headline: Google Issues Emergency Patch for Critical Chrome RCE Flaw Found by AI

Summary:
Google has released an emergency security update for the Chrome browser, addressing a critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in its V8 JavaScript engine. The flaw, tracked as CVE-2025-12036, was discovered by Google's internal AI-driven research project, 'Big Sleep.' Successful exploitation could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code on a user's system by tricking them into visiting a malicious website. The patch has been rolled out for Windows, macOS, and Linux users, who are urged to update their browsers immediately to mitigate the high-severity threat.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Google releases an emergency patch for CVE-2025-12036, a critical remote code execution vulnerability in the Chrome V8 JavaScript engine, discovered by an internal AI research project.

Article Slug: google-patches-critical-rce-flaw-cve-2025-12036-in-chrome-v8-engine

Published Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Nation-State and Financial Cybercrime Blur as Industrial Sector Becomes Top Target
item.description:
Headline: Nation-State and Financial Cybercrime Blur as Industrial Sector Becomes Top Target

Summary:
A new report from Trellix reveals a significant convergence between the tactics of nation-state actors and financially motivated cybercriminals, with both increasingly leveraging AI-powered tools. The industrial sector has emerged as the most targeted industry, accounting for over 36% of attacks analyzed between April and September 2025. The research highlights the dominance of PowerShell as a key attack tool, used in nearly 78% of ransomware campaigns. The United States remains the most targeted nation, and the ransomware landscape is highly fragmented, with the top five groups accounting for less than 40% of all incidents.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Threat Actor, Industrial Control Systems

Article Type: Report

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A new Trellix report shows a convergence of nation-state and financial cybercrime, with the industrial sector as the top target and PowerShell as the dominant tool in ransomware attacks.

Article Slug: nation-state-financial-cybercrime-converge-industrial-sector-targeted

Published Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: India Enacts New Telecom Cybersecurity Rules for IMEI and Mobile Number Validation
item.description:
Headline: India Enacts New Telecom Cybersecurity Rules for IMEI and Mobile Number Validation

Summary:
India's Ministry of Communications has enacted new cybersecurity regulations for its telecommunications sector, effective October 22, 2025. The 'Telecommunications (Telecom Cyber Security) Amendment Rules, 2025' introduce two key measures: the establishment of a centralized Mobile Number Validation (MNV) platform to secure digital communications, and stricter controls on International Mobile Equipment Identity (IMEI) numbers. The new IMEI rules prohibit the assignment of already-used IMEIs to new devices and mandate that sellers and buyers of used devices verify the IMEI against a national database to combat theft and tampering.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Regulatory, Policy and Compliance, Mobile Security

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: India enacts the Telecommunications (Telecom Cyber Security) Amendment Rules, 2025, establishing a mobile number validation platform and mandatory IMEI checks to combat device theft and fraud.

Article Slug: india-implements-new-telecom-cybersecurity-rules-for-imei-and-mobile-validation

Published Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: UN Convention Against Cybercrime Signed in Hanoi Amid Global Endorsement and Controversy
item.description:
Headline: UN Convention Against Cybercrime Signed in Hanoi Amid Global Endorsement and Controversy

Summary:
In a landmark event in Hanoi, Vietnam, representatives from nearly 100 UN member states have signed the United Nations Convention against Cybercrime. Adopted by the UN General Assembly in December 2024, this treaty, also known as the Hanoi Convention, establishes the first global legal framework for international cooperation in combating a wide array of online crimes, including fraud, child exploitation, and money laundering. While hailed as a milestone by the UN Secretary-General, the event drew criticism from rights groups over the choice of Vietnam as the host, and a major tech industry group, the Cybersecurity Tech Accord, declined to attend.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Nearly 100 UN member states sign the UN Convention against Cybercrime in Hanoi, Vietnam, establishing a global legal framework for international cooperation, despite controversy.

Article Slug: un-convention-against-cybercrime-signed-in-hanoi-vietnam

Published Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: EU Accuses Meta and TikTok of Breaching Digital Services Act Transparency Rules
item.description:
Headline: EU Accuses Meta and TikTok of Breaching Digital Services Act Transparency Rules

Summary:
The European Commission has issued preliminary findings that Meta's platforms (Facebook and Instagram) and TikTok have breached their obligations under the Digital Services Act (DSA). The Commission alleges the companies failed to provide adequate access to public data for researchers, hindering independent scrutiny of their platforms. Furthermore, Meta is accused of using 'dark patterns' and creating a burdensome process for users to report illegal content. These are initial findings, and both companies will have the opportunity to respond and propose remedies before any final decision or penalties are imposed.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Regulatory, Policy and Compliance

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: The European Commission issues preliminary findings that Meta (Facebook, Instagram) and TikTok have breached the Digital Services Act (DSA) by failing to provide data access to researchers and, for Meta, hindering illegal content reporting.

Article Slug: eu-finds-meta-and-tiktok-in-preliminary-breach-of-digital-services-act

Published Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: UPDATE: Patch Now: Microsoft Fixes 170+ Flaws, Including Four Actively Exploited Zero-Days
item.description:
Headline: Patch Now: Microsoft Fixes 170+ Flaws, Including Four Actively Exploited Zero-Days

Summary:
Microsoft has released its October 2025 Patch Tuesday update, a massive release fixing over 170 security vulnerabilities across its product ecosystem. The update is critical for all users, as it contains patches for four zero-day vulnerabilities that are being actively exploited in the wild. Two of these flaws, CVE-2025-24990 and CVE-2025-59230, allow for local privilege escalation to Administrator or SYSTEM rights. CISA has added the exploited vulnerabilities to its KEV catalog, mandating urgent patching for federal agencies.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Patch Management, Vulnerability

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Microsoft's October 2025 Patch Tuesday fixes over 170 vulnerabilities, including four zero-days (CVE-2025-24990, CVE-2025-59230) under active exploitation for privilege escalation. Prioritize immediate patching.

Article Slug: microsoft-october-2025-patch-tuesday-fixes-four-zero-days

Published Date: Thu, 16 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 16 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 12:00:00 GMT

Update Count: 1

Update History: 1 update recorded

Read Full Article →

item.title: UPDATE: Ransomware Attacks on Critical Industries Skyrocket by 34%, KELA Reports
item.description:
Headline: Ransomware Attacks on Critical Industries Skyrocket by 34%, KELA Reports

Summary:
A new report from cyber intelligence firm KELA reveals a staggering 34% year-over-year increase in ransomware attacks targeting critical industries between January and September 2025. These vital sectors, including manufacturing, healthcare, and energy, accounted for half of all 4,701 recorded global incidents. The United States was the most heavily targeted nation. The report also highlights the consolidation of the ransomware ecosystem, with just five groups—Qilin, Clop, Akira, Play, and SafePay—responsible for nearly a quarter of all attacks.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Intelligence, Cyberattack

Article Type: Report

Meta Description: A KELA report shows a 34% surge in ransomware attacks on critical industries in 2025, with the U.S. being the most targeted country and manufacturing seeing the largest increase.

Article Slug: ransomware-attacks-on-critical-industries-surge-34-percent

Published Date: Tue, 21 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 21 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 12:00:00 GMT

Update Count: 1

Update History: 1 update recorded

Read Full Article →

item.title: UPDATE: UK Gov & NCSC Issue Urgent Warning to FTSE 350 Boards on Cyber Resilience
item.description:
Headline: UK Gov & NCSC Issue Urgent Warning to FTSE 350 Boards on Cyber Resilience

Summary:
The UK's National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) and government ministers have sent a formal letter to the leaders of all FTSE 350 companies, demanding that cyber resilience be treated as a top board-level priority. The call to action follows the NCSC's latest annual review, which revealed a 50% increase in significant cyber incidents. The letter outlines three practical steps: adopt the government's Cyber Governance Code, enroll in the NCSC's Early Warning service, and mandate Cyber Essentials certification throughout supply chains.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Security Operations

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The UK government and NCSC have issued a formal letter to FTSE 350 companies, urging them to make cyber resilience a board-level priority following a 50% rise in major cyber incidents.

Article Slug: uk-government-and-ncsc-urge-businesses-to-bolster-cyber-defenses

Published Date: Wed, 22 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 22 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sat, 25 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Update Count: 1

Update History: 1 update recorded

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Urgent Patch for Actively Exploited WSUS Zero-Day!
item.description:
Headline: Urgent Patch for Actively Exploited WSUS Zero-Day!

Summary:
Microsoft has released an emergency out-of-band security update for a critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in Windows Server Update Services (WSUS), tracked as CVE-2025-59287. The flaw, which can be exploited by an unauthenticated attacker, is being actively used in attacks, leading the U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) to add it to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog. A compromise of a WSUS server could grant attackers a powerful foothold within an enterprise network, enabling widespread lateral movement and subsequent attacks. Administrators are urged to apply the patch immediately.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Microsoft releases an emergency out-of-band patch for CVE-2025-59287, a critical RCE vulnerability in WSUS that is being actively exploited, posing a severe risk to enterprise networks.

Article Slug: critical-wsus-zero-day-cve-2025-59287-actively-exploited

Published Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Massive Prosper Breach Exposes SSNs of 17.6M Users
item.description:
Headline: Massive Prosper Breach Exposes SSNs of 17.6M Users

Summary:
Peer-to-peer lending platform Prosper Marketplace has disclosed a massive data breach affecting 17.6 million individuals. The incident, detected on September 2, 2025, involved an unauthorized third party gaining direct access to company databases and exfiltrating a vast trove of sensitive personal and financial data. The stolen information includes full names, Social Security numbers, government-issued IDs, income levels, and IP addresses, placing millions of users at significant risk of identity theft and sophisticated phishing attacks.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Ransomware, Phishing

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Peer-to-peer lender Prosper Marketplace suffers a massive data breach impacting 17.6 million users, with sensitive data like Social Security numbers stolen.

Article Slug: prosper-marketplace-data-breach-impacts-17-million-users

Published Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Iranian APT 'Phoenix' Backdoor Hits 100+ Governments
item.description:
Headline: Iranian APT 'Phoenix' Backdoor Hits 100+ Governments

Summary:
A cyber-espionage campaign attributed to an Iranian-linked Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) group has compromised over 100 government institutions worldwide. The attackers are utilizing a custom, multi-stage backdoor dubbed 'Phoenix' to achieve their objectives. Initial access is gained through a mix of credential spraying and spear-phishing. Once inside, the Phoenix backdoor is used to conduct reconnaissance, escalate privileges, and establish long-term persistence for intelligence gathering operations.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Malware

Article Type: Analysis

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A sophisticated cyber-espionage campaign by an Iranian-linked APT group uses a new backdoor called 'Phoenix' to target over 100 government institutions worldwide.

Article Slug: iranian-apt-deploys-phoenix-backdoor-against-government-targets

Published Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: 'Jingle Thief' Group Steals Gift Cards via Cloud & M365
item.description:
Headline: 'Jingle Thief' Group Steals Gift Cards via Cloud & M365

Summary:
A financially motivated cybercriminal group dubbed 'Jingle Thief' is actively targeting retail and consumer services companies in a campaign focused on large-scale gift card fraud. According to research from Unit 42, the group gains initial access via credential harvesting from phishing and smishing attacks. They then pivot to the victim's cloud environment, specifically Microsoft 365, to move laterally, find gift card issuance systems, and establish persistence by registering rogue authenticator applications. The campaign highlights a growing trend of abusing legitimate cloud services for financial crime.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cloud Security, Cyberattack

Article Type: Analysis

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A cybercriminal group named 'Jingle Thief' is targeting retail and consumer services companies by exploiting their cloud and Microsoft 365 environments to commit large-scale gift card fraud.

Article Slug: jingle-thief-hackers-exploit-cloud-for-gift-card-fraud

Published Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Google Patches 6th Actively Exploited Chrome Zero-Day of 2025
item.description:
Headline: Google Patches 6th Actively Exploited Chrome Zero-Day of 2025

Summary:
Google has issued an emergency security update for its Chrome web browser to address CVE-2025-10585, a high-severity type confusion vulnerability in the V8 JavaScript engine. This marks the sixth time in 2025 that Google has patched a Chrome zero-day vulnerability that was being actively exploited in the wild. The flaw could allow an attacker to achieve arbitrary code execution on a victim's machine by tricking them into visiting a malicious website. All users of Chrome and other Chromium-based browsers are urged to update immediately.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Google has patched CVE-2025-10585, the sixth actively exploited zero-day vulnerability in Chrome this year, which is a high-severity type confusion flaw in the V8 JavaScript engine.

Article Slug: google-patches-sixth-actively-exploited-chrome-zero-day-cve-2025-10585

Published Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Agenda Ransomware Evolves, Hits Critical Infrastructure
item.description:
Headline: Agenda Ransomware Evolves, Hits Critical Infrastructure

Summary:
The Agenda ransomware group, also known as Qilin, is escalating its attacks by targeting critical infrastructure sectors with evolved tactics. According to research from Trend Micro, the ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) operation is using a cross-platform approach, abusing legitimate remote management tools and deploying Linux-based ransomware on Windows hosts to evade security. The group also employs Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver (BYOVD) attacks to neutralize endpoint defenses and steals backup credentials to hinder recovery, primarily targeting high-value organizations in the U.S., Canada, and the U.K.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Industrial Control Systems

Article Type: Analysis

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The Agenda (Qilin) ransomware group is evolving its tactics to attack critical infrastructure, using legitimate tools and cross-platform techniques to bypass security.

Article Slug: agenda-qilin-ransomware-abuses-legit-tools-targets-critical-infrastructure

Published Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Tengu Ransomware Hits Brazilian Education Provider
item.description:
Headline: Tengu Ransomware Hits Brazilian Education Provider

Summary:
The Tengu ransomware group has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack against UniCursos, a prominent education provider in Brazil. The attack, which was posted to the group's leak site on October 23, 2025, follows the common double-extortion model, where the attackers threaten to publish sensitive stolen data if their ransom demands are not met. The incident highlights the continued targeting of the education sector by ransomware gangs, who view them as valuable targets due to the sensitive student and staff data they hold.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: The Tengu ransomware group has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack on the Brazilian education provider UniCursos, threatening to leak stolen data.

Article Slug: tengu-ransomware-claims-attack-on-brazilian-education-provider-unicursos

Published Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Ransomware Hits Jewett-Cameron, Steals Financial Data
item.description:
Headline: Ransomware Hits Jewett-Cameron, Steals Financial Data

Summary:
Jewett-Cameron, an Oregon-based manufacturing and distribution company, has confirmed in an SEC filing that it suffered a ransomware attack on October 15, 2025. The attack caused significant disruption to its business operations and resulted in the theft of sensitive corporate data. The exfiltrated information reportedly includes IT and financial data being prepared for the company's upcoming Form 10-K filing, as well as screen captures from video meetings. The unidentified attackers have demanded a ransom and threatened to leak the stolen material.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Oregon-based manufacturer Jewett-Cameron confirms a ransomware attack disrupted its operations and led to the theft of sensitive financial data intended for an SEC filing.

Article Slug: jewett-cameron-operations-disrupted-by-ransomware-attack

Published Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Lawsuit Hits SC School District After Ransomware Breach
item.description:
Headline: Lawsuit Hits SC School District After Ransomware Breach

Summary:
South Carolina's Lexington-Richland School District 5 (LR5) is facing a class-action lawsuit following a ransomware attack in June 2025 that exposed the personally identifiable information (PII) of over 31,000 students, staff, and alumni. The lawsuit alleges that the school district was negligent in protecting sensitive data and violated state law by failing to provide timely and complete notification of the breach. The compromised data included names, birthdates, Social Security numbers, and financial files, making it one of the most significant breaches for an educational institution in the region.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Ransomware, Regulatory

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Lexington-Richland School District 5 in South Carolina is facing a class-action lawsuit after a ransomware attack exposed the personal data of over 31,000 individuals.

Article Slug: lawsuit-filed-against-south-carolina-school-district-after-ransomware-attack

Published Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Lazarus Group's 'Operation DreamJob' Targets EU Drone-Makers
item.description:
Headline: Lazarus Group's 'Operation DreamJob' Targets EU Drone-Makers

Summary:
The notorious North Korea-linked APT group, Lazarus, is conducting a cyber-espionage campaign dubbed 'Operation DreamJob' targeting European defense and aerospace companies. The campaign specifically focuses on firms involved in Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) technology. The attackers use sophisticated social engineering, creating fake recruiter profiles and job offers to lure employees. The ultimate goal is to compromise the target's network to steal sensitive intellectual property related to advanced drone technology.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Phishing

Article Type: Analysis

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The North Korean Lazarus APT group is targeting European defense and drone companies in a new cyber-espionage campaign dubbed 'Operation DreamJob' that uses fake job offers as a lure.

item.title: UPDATE: Critical RCE Flaw in WSUS Allows Unauthenticated SYSTEM Takeover
item.description:
Headline: Critical RCE Flaw in WSUS Allows Unauthenticated SYSTEM Takeover

Summary:
A critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability, CVE-2025-59287, with a CVSS score of 9.8, has been discovered in Microsoft's Windows Server Update Services (WSUS). The flaw allows an unauthenticated attacker on the same network to gain SYSTEM-level privileges on a vulnerable server by sending a maliciously crafted cookie. The vulnerability stems from an unsafe deserialization process. While not yet exploited in the wild, Microsoft rates exploitation as "more likely." Given that compromising WSUS could enable an attacker to distribute malicious updates across an entire enterprise, immediate patching is strongly advised.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Supply Chain Attack

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: A critical remote code execution vulnerability, CVE-2025-59287 (CVSS 9.8), in Microsoft WSUS allows unauthenticated attackers to gain SYSTEM privileges. Immediate patching is required.

Article Slug: critical-rce-flaw-cve-2025-59287-in-windows-server-update-services

Published Date: Sun, 19 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 19 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

item.title: UPDATE: Massive Prosper Data Breach Exposes Social Security Numbers of 17.6 Million Users
item.description:
Headline: Massive Prosper Data Breach Exposes Social Security Numbers of 17.6 Million Users

Summary:
The peer-to-peer lending platform Prosper has confirmed a catastrophic data breach compromising the sensitive personally identifiable information (PII) of approximately 17.6 million people. The exposed data includes full names, physical addresses, IP addresses, income levels, and, most critically, Social Security numbers. The breach, first detected in September 2025, places millions of individuals at severe risk of identity theft and sophisticated financial fraud.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Data Breach, Phishing, Cloud Security

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 7 minutes

Meta Description: Peer-to-peer lending platform Prosper has suffered a major data breach exposing the PII, including Social Security numbers, of 17.6 million individuals.

Article Slug: prosper-lending-data-breach-affects-17-million

item.title: UPDATE: Iran's MuddyWater APT Targets 100+ Governments with Phoenix Backdoor
item.description:
Headline: Iran's MuddyWater APT Targets 100+ Governments with Phoenix Backdoor

Summary:
The Iranian state-sponsored threat group MuddyWater is conducting a large-scale cyber-espionage campaign targeting over 100 government entities, primarily in the Middle East and North Africa (MENA). According to Group-IB, the attackers are using phishing emails sent from a compromised mailbox, leveraging the NordVPN service for anonymity. The emails contain malicious Word documents that use macros to deploy version 4 of the 'Phoenix' backdoor, a payload designed for foreign intelligence gathering. The campaign highlights the group's return to classic macro-based attack vectors.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Phishing

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: The Iranian APT group MuddyWater is targeting over 100 government entities in the MENA region with a new cyber-espionage campaign deploying the Phoenix v4 backdoor via phishing and malicious macros.

Article Slug: iran-linked-muddywater-apt-targets-governments-with-phoenix-backdoor

item.title: UPDATE: Unit 42 Exposes 'Smishing Deluge' from China and 'Jingle Thief' Gift Card Fraud
item.description:
Headline: Unit 42 Exposes 'Smishing Deluge' from China and 'Jingle Thief' Gift Card Fraud

Summary:
Researchers at Palo Alto Networks' Unit 42 have detailed two distinct and significant cybercrime operations. The first, a massive smishing campaign dubbed 'The Smishing Deluge,' is attributed to a China-based threat actor and is flooding mobile users globally with malicious SMS messages. The second campaign, named 'Jingle Thief,' is a sophisticated cloud-based operation focused on automating the theft and monetization of gift cards. These findings, highlighted in Unit 42's October Threat Bulletin, showcase the diverse tactics of modern criminals, from large-scale social engineering to highly targeted financial fraud.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Phishing, Threat Intelligence, Cloud Security

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Palo Alto Networks' Unit 42 has exposed 'The Smishing Deluge,' a global SMS phishing campaign from China, and 'Jingle Thief,' a separate cloud-based operation that automates gift card fraud.

Article Slug: palo-alto-networks-uncovers-smishing-and-gift-card-fraud-campaigns
